snippet: While votes were still being counted in two tight races, California Democratic officials talked about a new era that would effectively bring one-party rule to the nation’s largest state.
abstract: California’s Democrats appear poised to gain two-thirds supermajority in State Legislature as votes are still being counted for two tight Assembly races that Democrats are projected to win; victory will effectively bring one-party rule to nation's largest state.
lead_paragraph: While votes were still being counted in two tight races, California Democratic officials talked about a new era that would effectively bring one-party rule to the nation’s largest state.

headline.seo: Democrats Likely to Win Supermajority in California Legislature
headline.main: California Democrats Likely to Win Supermajority
headline.print_headline: Democrats on Cusp of Winning Supermajority in California Legislature
